channel.title: Music : NPR
channel.description: NPR Music features, streams, live concerts and music news.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The Suffers, A Houston Funk Troupe, Makes The Big Crossover
item.description: A year ago, the 10-piece band was working day jobs and gigging on weekends. Ari Shapiro talks with members Kam Franklin and Adam Castaneda about making the leap that landed them on a national stage.
item.content:encoded: A year ago, the 10-piece band was working day jobs and gigging on weekends. Ari Shapiro talks with members Kam Franklin and Adam Castaneda about making the leap that landed them on a national stage.
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: The ELEW Trio With Veal And Tain
item.description: Pianist Eric Lewis did a turn in the crossover celebrity spotlight with his "rockjazz" method. But he pledges allegiance to "the jazz republic" in a new trio with Reginald Veal and Jeff Watts.
item.content:encoded: Pianist Eric Lewis did a turn in the crossover celebrity spotlight with his "rockjazz" method. But he pledges allegiance to "the jazz republic" in a new trio with Reginald Veal and Jeff Watts.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Jarenwattananon

item.title: Matthew Logan Vasquez On World Cafe
item.description: The Delta Spirit singer rocks solo in a special episode, recorded live in Austin, Texas.
item.content:encoded: The Delta Spirit singer rocks solo in a special episode, recorded live in Austin, Texas.

item.title: OK Go's New Video Is As Incredible As You'd Expect
item.description: The video for "Upside Down & Inside Out" shows what the band can do in little to no gravity.
item.content:encoded: The video for "Upside Down & Inside Out" shows what the band can do in little to no gravity.
item.dc:creator: Robin Hilton

item.title: Love Stories In Union Square
item.description: Alt.Latino puts aside its hatred of Valentine's Day to hear New Yorkers' tales of love lost and found.
item.content:encoded: Alt.Latino puts aside its hatred of Valentine's Day to hear New Yorkers' tales of love lost and found.
item.dc:creator: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: Viking's Choice: The World Is A Beautiful Place, 'Katamari Duquette'
item.description: This might be the most desperately intense song in the emo band's catalog, and that's saying a lot.
item.content:encoded: This might be the most desperately intense song in the emo band's catalog, and that's saying a lot.
item.dc:creator: Lars Gotrich

item.title: KCRW Presents: Cage The Elephant
item.description: Watch the Kentucky-bred garage-rock band perform "Trouble" live on Morning Becomes Eclectic.
item.content:encoded: Watch the Kentucky-bred garage-rock band perform "Trouble" live on Morning Becomes Eclectic.
item.dc:creator: Jason Bentley

item.title: Black Mountain Shreds In Epic New Video
item.description: What unfolds in a strange clip for "Mothers of the Sun" by the Vancouver psych rock group is really anybody's guess, but one thing is certain: it is a monstrously good rock anthem.
item.content:encoded: What unfolds in a strange clip for "Mothers of the Sun" by the Vancouver psych rock group is really anybody's guess, but one thing is certain: it is a monstrously good rock anthem.
item.dc:creator: Robin Hilton

item.title: Songs We Love: Thad Jones/Mel Lewis Orchestra, 'Backbone'
item.description: The first-ever gig of the most influential jazz big band of the last 50 years has emerged. It lays complex arrangements over simple blues forms. It also swings like crazy.
item.content:encoded: The first-ever gig of the most influential jazz big band of the last 50 years has emerged. It lays complex arrangements over simple blues forms. It also swings like crazy.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Jarenwattananon

item.title: First Listen: Birds Of Chicago, 'Real Midnight'
item.description: J.T. Nero and Allison Russell like to describe the music they make as "secular gospel." Their new album together is full of nostalgia, farewells and looming finales.
item.content:encoded: J.T. Nero and Allison Russell like to describe the music they make as "secular gospel." Their new album together is full of nostalgia, farewells and looming finales.
item.dc:creator: Jewly Hight

item.title: First Listen: Wolfmother, 'Victorious'
item.description: Just as an arena is built to hold anyone and everyone, Wolfmother's arena-rock is designed to contain everything that inspires it.
item.content:encoded: Just as an arena is built to hold anyone and everyone, Wolfmother's arena-rock is designed to contain everything that inspires it.
item.dc:creator: Jason Heller

item.title: First Listen: Carrie Rodriguez, 'Lola'
item.description: The veteran singer and fiddler combines seemingly disparate influences into a single, gloriously cohesive Spanglish statement.
item.content:encoded: The veteran singer and fiddler combines seemingly disparate influences into a single, gloriously cohesive Spanglish statement.
item.dc:creator: Felix Contreras

item.title: First Listen: Africaine 808, 'Basar'
item.description: The Berlin duo's club music transcends dance-floor stereotypes through extreme juxtapositions, while drawing its power from a TR 808 drum machine and a world of sound.
item.content:encoded: The Berlin duo's club music transcends dance-floor stereotypes through extreme juxtapositions, while drawing its power from a TR 808 drum machine and a world of sound.
item.dc:creator: Piotr Orlov

item.title: First Listen: BJ The Chicago Kid, 'In My Mind'
item.description: The Windy City soul man has established himself as a supreme collaborator; his Motown debut features guest spots from Kendrick Lamar and Chance The Rapper.
item.content:encoded: The Windy City soul man has established himself as a supreme collaborator; his Motown debut features guest spots from Kendrick Lamar and Chance The Rapper.
item.dc:creator: Timmhotep Aku

item.title: First Listen: Prins Thomas, 'Principe Del Norte'
item.description: These nine pieces expand to nearly 100 minutes of "cosmic disco" music, soundtracking a voyage into the deepest spaces of the mind.
item.content:encoded: These nine pieces expand to nearly 100 minutes of "cosmic disco" music, soundtracking a voyage into the deepest spaces of the mind.
item.dc:creator: Andy Beta
